meanings.definition: To leave or give by will after one's death.
meanings.sent1: She was bequeathing her antique jewelry to her granddaughter in her will.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy philanthropist was bequeathing a large sum of money to charity.
meanings.sent3: The old man joked that he would bequeath his collection of socks to his cat in his will.
meanings.sent4: The author was bequeathing his literary legacy to future generations.
meanings.sent5: The ancient king bequeathed his kingdom to his loyal advisor before passing away.

meanings.sent1: The tradition of storytelling was bequeathed from generation to generation.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was bequeathing knowledge to her students through engaging lessons.
meanings.sent3: The family recipe for apple pie was bequeathed with strict instructions not to share it outside the family.
meanings.sent4: The wisdom of the elders was bequeathed to the young leaders of the tribe.
meanings.sent5: The ancient artifact was bequeathed through the centuries, carrying with it a mysterious history.
